description: Construction of a two storey (three bedroom) detached house (ground and basement levels) with one off-street parking space, cycle storage and refuse enclosure (following demolition of existing garage)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: External materials finish stated in the application form, 1005/Loc. 1 (received 17/07/2014), 1005/EX01, 1005/EX02, 1005/PL01 (received 10/09/2014), 1005/PL02B, 1005/PL03B, 1005/PL04B, 1005/PL05B, 1005/PL06A and 1005/PL07B, received 29/09/2014 and daylight and sunlight report prepared by Schroeder Begg Ltd (ref: 1013/G dated April 2015), received 19/05/2015.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development hereby approved shall be in accordance with those stated on the approved drawings ref:  1005/PL05B, 1005/PL06A and 1005/PL07B, received 29/09/2014 and in the application form.      Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the Consolidated London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | The trees and plantings shown on approved plans ref: 1005/PL02B, 1005/PL03B, 1005/PL04B, 1005/PL05B and 1005/PL07B, received 29/09/2014 shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development, and thereafter retained and maintained in perpetuity. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and to ensure suitable a suitable level of amenity space is provided for occupant of the dwelling hereby permitted, in accordance with policies 7D of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No part of the rear flat roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 and any related amendments, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls of the building permitted.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted, details of the following matters shall be submitted to and approved the local planning authority in writing.  1.	Contractors access arrangement for vehicles, plant and personnel,  2.	Contractors site storage/compound,  3.	The means of moving, storing and stacking all building materials, plant and equipment around and adjacent to the site,  4.	The arrangement for parking of contractors vehicles and contractors personnel vehicles.  5.	Details of demolition, excavation and retaining walls.  Thereafter, the development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To protect the amenity of the adjoining properties during the construction period in accordance with policies 1.1, & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The residential unit shall be constructed to a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010/ Addendum 2014 for England Technical Guide). The residential unit shall not commence until evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and a CfSH Preliminary Assessment are submitted to the Local Planning Authority for information.    Within 3 months of the commencement of the development, CfSH Interim Design Stage Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the development, CfSH Post-Construction Stage Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented.   Following any approval of the 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the CfSH Level 4 shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.     Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policy 5.2G of Ealing Development Management DPD (10th December 2013), Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015. | The waste and recycle storage store shown on approved plans ref: 1005/PL02B, 1005/PL03B, 1005/PL04B and 1005/PL05B, received 29/09/2014 shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and thereafter retained and maintained in perpetuity.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16.
